ratings.comment: You'll never be bored. I think he tries (successfully) to present information in the alongside the academic context at the time the discoveries were made.

This class is to teach a method of thinking about problems -- as a system affected by seemingly unconnected inputs. The optional lab was illustration of lecture points.  Tests are applied knowledge and thought, not just regurgitation.  He admits, you either get it or not. Visit Office hours, have a cuppa tea, offer to buy him a beer at the Union.

Pretty awesome professor; go talk to him, he'll take that into account in your grade;  you'll get a bonus if you're a pretty girl and you sit in the front; definitely was hit on a couple times; Plants & Man is a really interesting class, and Allen makes it fun

Tim Aleen was one of the most interesting professors to have taught at UW. His tests, like his labs and lectures were designed to make you think about information and make the connections that won't be made by simply remembering facts and dates.

Terrible class. I didn't get how the lectures related to each other at all. He was entertaining at times, sure, but the tests and lectures are NOT worth your time. Trust me. I should have dropped the class when I had the chance. Total regret.

Tim is a very entertaining prof. and if you get him and his style, he will be the best prof you've ever had. But, you have to approach his courses with an open mind; don't cling to what you think you know or he'll show you how you're wrong. Do the reading, attend lecture, and if you still don't get it, go to office hours. But, the best prof I had.
Tim Allen and his classes are completely ridiculous in every way possible.  Whether you will perceive that as a positive or a negative largely depends on you as a person.

He's an intelligent man, and he may change the way you think; however, if you want to take a science class and actually learn science from it, don't take his class. He's pompous and arrogant, his lectures were disorganized, and the tests weren't on the material from class at all - or from the readings! The only way to do well is to guess well.

terribly hard. teaches you his own opinions and view on ecology and expected you to memorize why he holds those views. he teaches by word of mouth with some barely helpful power points, making attendance basically mandatory. his final exams average around 50% with up to 10 answers for his multiple choice, which are extremely vague. try to avoid

Different from any other Professor I have ever had. First few lectures I was scratching my head but later I started to understand what he was getting at. My biggest tip is to keep an open mind, form a study group, understand his concepts and apply it to the practice exams. Most of all: don't worry! He is a softy in the end, there is a great curve!

Very entertaining lecture, 1st few lectures are all about his opinion, but then he gets into ecology.  His test is a bit ridiculous, but curve is good.  Choose different professor if works into your schedule, but don't freak out if you get Allen you'll do just fine.

Worst professor at UW, made me so frustrated and constantly tore apart anyone who was pre-med. STAY AWAY from this guy, he will bring you nothing but confusion, and you aren't learning any ecology, just his theories and listening to his arrogant statements in class.  Pointless unit in 152.

He is one of most egotistical people that I have ever met. With the exception of the large curve everything about this class annoyed me to all ends. Every lecture was him talking about random topics that relate nothing whatsoever to the exams. If you want higher than a 50% on the exams all you can do is pray. Stay away from Allen at all costs.

Professor Allen may change your view of the world. Then again, he may not. I did very well in his class. I recommend doing exactly what his syllabus tells you to to do and form a st group. As for his personality. He is Ironic which comes off condescending sometimes,but he is a VERY nice guy if you get to know him. He care truly cares about students
This is a great class for freshmen. I enjoyed going to lecture. If you go to his office hours and form a study group, you will do well. 5/5

One of my favorite classes at Madison thusfar. For the tests: focus on the essays (the multiple choice questions are stupidly hard), do the practice questions online, hope your classmates fail (the curve is great). If you do the reading/get into it, the class is rewarding, but be prepared for his notorious arrogance. I found it entertaining.

Professor Allen is an outstanding professor. His lectures are awesome and usaully entertaining. However the dude is extremely full of himself and has some different views on the world. The class could be called "Into the mind of Tim Allen" Besides some of his controversial and IMO messed up views, the guy is a great guy.
fun, original, engaging.  expect to do some real work and cope with his (pretend) ego.  tests are difficult, but the curve is huge.
Eccentric professor but also arrogant. Lecture and Lab have almost nothing to do with each other.

Let's be honest.His lectures are boring, although he is rather eccentric making them slightly entertaining.  He is arrogant, & intimidating, degrading. BUT he is pretty "easy". Sure the exam is tough and the average is a 50. But the curve is FAIR! I barely studied and got a 93%..without meeting with a discussion group every week. Really not thatbad

He will himself admit that most people who have him for 152 hate him. He is absolutely right. He is pompous, arrogant, clearly hates his 152 students and insults them on a daily basis. Test was ridiculously hard, as the questions were terribly worded and open to interpretation, but it works out OK because the average is ~50% and has a nice curve.
Pompous, British, highly respects intelligence.

Pompous, arrogant, but everything he says he is. It changed the way I view the world. Brilliant theoritician, half the fun of the class is trying to figure out how his lectures all fit together. Tests require lots of studying but are more rewarding than any other test I have taken in college. Fair grader, rewards hard work. Tough class but awesome

This class was completely useless.  You sign up to take a three credit ILS course and you have to go to lab, study more for the exams than I have ever had to in my entire college career. His lectures make no sense in relation to one another. I found out that some people don't have to take the final simply because he "likes them more." USELESS!!

Prof. Allen is one strange character, as he says, some hate him, some like him. I've found myself on the fence. He is pompous and full of himself, and at the same time does make lectures interesting. attend lecture and you'll be fine. he assigns alot of reading where he will only ask one question per book on the exam, some are worth reading.

Tim is truly an amazing teacher. Take this course. It will change how you see the world, or at least science. It can be difficult, if you focus on every little fact instead of the overall narratives. Slackers should run from this course, because it is a lot of work, but it is absolutely worth it, if you're willing to so the work.
This is the best class you'll ever take at university!!

He team taught bio152 with stretton and vierstra and was probably the worst of the three.  He wasn't THAT bad though.  His lectures are entertaining and if you do the readings you'll be fine.  The exam was very difficult but he always curves it so that everyone ends up getting about 30 points back.  He isn't as bad as a lot make him out to be.
I didn't bother reading any of those articles he gave us and I still did fine. I'm sorry to all those that did and still got a B. Dr. Allen's useless if you ask me.

This guy is the most arrogant, hypocritical and egotistic guy on the planet.  He always throws in dirty innuendos in his lectures. Don't let his style scare you. Go to lecture and listen...do not take notes.  Do the readings and I guarantee you a B on his test.  A 50% was curved to a 80% or something.
Most arrogant person I've ever met.  Great Professor.

Take Botony 240 instead of ILS 252, almost the exact same class but Bot240 is easier.  Anyway, TIM ALLEN'S CLASS IS THE BEST!!! Tests are literally impossible, but don't freak out. Extra credit is available and he's definitely willing to help anyone that asks.  To the people whining: shut up, you should have done the readings.
He says at the beginning of class he may insult you - get over it and focus on his message, you will find very few other professors (if any as charismatic and inspiring as this man

Each lecture was interesting I guess...but forgetable for retaining the information. The tests are impossible to study for. He has a personality which makes him the spectacle, not the course material.

This class should be mandatory for all UW Madison students.  Lectures are FUN and EXCITING about 90% of the time, occasionally a boring one.  Exams and project are a bit difficult, but if you go to class and do most of the reading you should come out fine.  Plus, this class will most likely teach you something that stays in there past graduation.

Plants and Man is incredible.  Tim Allen is incredible.  Tests are hard, but there is a generous curve.  Readings are absolutely necessary.  Quote: "...when the conservative christians were saying that AIDS was a good thing, and it was the wrath of God, I wished there was some disease you could get from Bible thumping."  Increible, take this class.

Awesome class.  It may take you some time to figure out what the hell Allen is talking about, but once you do, you enter a whole new world of scientific understanding.  I highly recommend a systems class to anyone who is willing to recognize their own assumptions and the impacts such assumptions have on their science.

His classes are amazing. His lectures stimulating; yet, somewhat disorganized. The tangents are always juicy, fun. The concepts are big and post-modern. Welcome to systems biology with the most fun professor at UW. Take one of his classes: I DARE YOU.

The material is very off topic and presented in a confusing manner. While the professor is quite arrogant, which lowers the quality of teaching, he is not able to follow up with real information. Only take any of his courses (which are all the same, really) if you just want to goof around with biological concepts, but don't actually LIKE Biology.

He is quite arrogant and a real wacko at times. The material doesn't always make sense but allen knows stuff that is interesting in general. Be sure to do the readings if you take this class, the tests are almost completely based on them. Allen thinks very highly of himself which gets old over time, EX: "I'm the best teacher you will ever have"

Hilarious and brilliant professor.  His supposed arrogance is part of the ruse--part of the act.  He took us canoeing on the Kickapoo River, hiking through bogs, and showed us how to look at a landscape and interpret it.  His truly unique approach will help you stay engaged, and unlike many scientists, he has a deep respect for other disciplines.

Allen is a strange, interesting, mysterious person.  I don't remember the botanical specifics of his class --and in fairness, never really cared that much about them.  I took the class for him.  Allen teaches you, implicitly, how to enjoy life, feel responsible for your world, and be a "worthy member of a worthy species and nation."
He's sort of insane and irritatingly arrogant.  However, will excuse students from final under certain circumstances... take the optional oral and NEVER SAY YOU DON'T KNOW... **** him instead.
An absolute pleasure.  Challenges you to think outside the box...a LOT.  Lectures are exciting and interesting.

One of the worst college experiences to date. Professor Allen teaches you very little in terms of basic ecology and lots about his personal opinions about anything and everything. Only take his classes if you want to hear him sing his own praises for 50 excruciating minutes.
Allen is the man.  I cried in lecture more than once if that is any indication of how powerfull this class is.

Absolutely the worst professor I have had.  Allen gives his own opinions rather than science, is largely mistaken when it comes to the history aspect of what he teaches, presents his material in a completely incoherent manner, and has an almost unbelievably smug attitude towards everything and everyone related to his class.  Avoid him at all costs!

Professor Allen has got to be one of the most interesting professors I have ever had. I truely enjoyed going to his lectures. Every one of them was very interesting. But, be careful, he is very tough. His tests are very hard too. They consist of multiple choice with around 9 choices per question. If you're not a slacker, enjoy this professor.
I loved him! Every lecture was a show! You just have to think outside the box and like him to get a good grade.

Very interesting, and challenges you to think in a different perspective, his lectures are so interesting, I loved him. He was great and inspired me on so many levels. I have never though about science in this way and would recommend him to anyone. He is my favorite teacher here at Madison.

This guy teaches philosphy regarding the scientific method not ecology and he does so poorly.  He gives you readings that suck and then he cites himself.  This guys science is rotten, and to make matters worse he is stuck up.  I took Ecology 260 here and thought this would be easy never mind.  If you take him enjoy a total asswhipe.
Absolutely terrible...some of his ideas are incredibly vague. He thinks he is so damn smart just because he thinks about things diffeently than most professionals. Avoid at all costs!!

one of the biggest, most pompous jerks i have had the unfortune to deal with.  should be teaching philosophy, since he thinks everything besides what he does is wrong. arrogant, impossible, crude, awful.  exam avg is 50, straight grading scale too----your own problem if you take him
Very interesting course.  Highly recommended

In this class is truly up to you. I took it and got ill the week before the major paper was due. He gave me a BC for turning in my research and thesis statement. If you are not willing to change the way you think this probably isn't the class for you. I learned to appreciate science in this class and that a difficult class can also be rewarding
great class...take it.

Take this class. Seriously. Very difficult exams but fair when you understand his test styles.  Labs helpful and fun. You bake bread, make salads, learn about everything.you can brew beer as a project. He even lectures while cooking. Take this class seriously and you will learn alot. Dont take this if you are arrogant or hate ranting british men.

This class is awesome. He's such a fun guy to listen to and has the most interesting lecture topics. I learned a lot and laughed my ass off. He teaches about beer, wine, bread, even the proper way to brew tea. If you are at all interested in expanding your mind to cool subjects, take this course. Warning: extemely difficult tests with huge curves.
okay, i have to say, i learned like NOTHING in the class, but he is funny as hell and he gave me a 'b' for writting a paper about how i am never going to use botany ever again in my life!
No Comments
Ridiculous lectures... no relevance to ecology at all.  Test had an unbelievably generous curve though.. 36/50 was a 100% so dont get discouraged with him even though he's a horrible prof.

DO NOT TAKE INTRO TO SYSTEMS BIOLOGY. it's just an intro to his vague, abstract ideas that nobody understands. he didn't teach us what a systems approach was, and then expected us to be able to write a 15 page paper using one, and then told us we did poorly on them. but plants and man is an ok class

This man is so confusing and all over the place. His lectures have no flow and almost no relevance to the ecology portion of 152. He said that he will not answer any of our questions because he says everything in lecture (and that is even too confusing). Hate the monster! Good luck with him!
This class was more of an experience than a class.  I loved it.  Tim Allen puts on amazing performances, you'll laugh your ass off and learn a lot.

Awesome class, will change the way you think about think about the world. If you can't decide, trust me, a random internet entity...  take this class, or anything else he teaches, this guy is awesome, plus he kicked back brews with us at a 'turducken' party

He is certifiably insane. His lectures are more like performance art than anything else. He will booze it up with you if you make the stuff. Big points for his cooking. Not only that but I've never had a prof that sings old English drinking songs and admits he was in drag and likes phallus symbols.

You'll either love him or hate him. He's really arrogant, but also really intelligent. You have to work hard for the class, so you better like the material if you want to do well. if you don't like the material in the 1st week, get the hell out of there. Overall, it really teaches you how to think.

Pompous man. Materials (syllabus, labs, reader) are VERY unorganized as are lectures. Exams are unfair evaluation of classroom knowledge. Professor unable to make logical progressions in arguments based on facts rather uses "arm-chair" science to arrive at unsubstantiated conclusions.
Super interesting course, but really hard.  Crazy tests and interesting labs.  Overall a fun, and intriguing.
The lectures were mildly amusing, watching him flail around in front.  The material?  Interesting and thought provoking, however studying for his exam was confusing and stressful.

Awful prof. Run, don't walk, away from this guy. Needed three TAs (whom you weren't allowed to talk to) just to set up his projectors. He wouldn't let me brew beer despite having a brewmaster friend help me, and his classes made me fall asleep. Blowhard.

Could anyone be any more unclear than this bloke? He has a thick British accent and mumbles and slurs his words, mostly because I think he is really passionate about his work. Apparently he's a great ecologist cuz he never lets you forget it. And the

A truly amazing prof & class. One of the most intelligent people I've ever met. You won't find a better lecturer. Labs were great and very helpful. Cooking, singing and beer-brewing skills are very helpful in this class. Great learning experience!
No Comments
No Comments
